text:
For theme i have test upload by using new upload option in ( theme-> upload ) it also show in when i submit theme to Asset Marketplace.
I have develop theme by using CLI in demo account and marketplace account i want to upload direct.
Can i upload direct?

Hi <@U2H3TT8F2> !
We have prepared our HubSpot theme which is validated via CLI v. 3.0.10 but, unfortunately, we get an error message when trying to submit the theme. Please check the related screenshots.
There are only a few days left to submit the theme so any help will be greatly appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey Makara, if it is showing in you list of assets to list via the marketplace asset listing flow, then you should be ok to submit it that way :slightly_smiling_face:

I am still a little unclear about the ask for the demo image. Would you be able to provide me (can be via DM also) some links to show me what it is you are looking to do? A visual may help me understand.
hi <@U02J4BHP6AD>, can you send me a direct message with a link to the validation screen for this item? I can see what i can find out on my end.

This is my module section
<https://imgur.com/3GfCIyQ>
every section i have image but i store it in HubSpot demo site.
So can i link image url to my module and home-template... ?

EX:
"team_box_position" : "Manager",
    "image" : {
      "src" : "<https://f.HubSpotusercontent20.net/hubfs/21265376/team5.jpeg>"
    }
<@U2H3TT8F2> Please help me with this question
Checking now on this, please give me a few minutes to verify internally on this

Hey Makara, itâ€™s advised to go the route of using the `get_asset_url` . By using the absolute path method, this runs the risk of this image being swapped out or removed and could lead to many websites being changed without their doing which goes against the self-contained purpose of themes.
With the size being an issue, I would recommend using an image optimization site like tinypng to compress the images.
Ok thanks you,  so we have only solution to store image in theme and use get_asset_url in template for display image.
